causes_communes: Serve short backspin to opponent's backhand
Opponent pushes serve to your forehand or backhand
Server starts rally with topspin serve

debutant.nom: Serve short backspin to opponent's backhand
debutant.description: Serve short backspin to opponent's backhand; he pushes to your backhand; you backhand loop; POP. Alternate versions: Your first backhand loop goes to a specified location, then POP. Or take it one step further, and opponent's first block goes to a specified location.

debutant.nom: Serve short side-top to forehand or backhand
debutant.description: Server serves varied long serves to opponent's backhand. Opponent soft loops serve back. You attack, POP.

intermediaire.nom: Pushing game with rallies starting with a backspin serve
intermediaire.description: Play a pushing game where both players can only push, with rallies starting with a backspin serve. But since most players push better on the backhand, there might be a tendency to push to the forehand in this game, since the opponent isn't allowed to attack.

avance.nom: Lobbing, fishing, or chopping game to work on your defense
avance.description: Play a lobbing, fishing, or chopping game to work on your defense, where you aren't allowed to attack. Alternate version is where you can attack, but must win the point on one shot if you do.

exercices_complementaires.nom: Serve short backspin to opponent's backhand; he pushes to your backhand; you backhand loop; POP.
exercices_complementaires.description: Server serves short backspin to opponent's backhand. Opponent pushes serve to your backhand or forehand. You attack, POP.

erreurs_a_eviter: Don't get into the habit of trying to rip every ball
